reviewText: Six year old thought it was funny. Penguin was very entertaining & a little weird. As an adult I lost interest.

The animation is very primitive and the dialogue is lackluster. Most attempts at humor fail. And would film makers please stop pairing penguins and polar bears (two species that live on opposite sides of the planet).
Kids loved this movie. funny animation and funny jokes. a must watch with kids and some hot chocolate. kids wanted to watch it over and over
Cute movie. Reminded us of a low-budget Arthur Christmas, but our kids enjoyed it. I recommend it for family movie night!
Great show!  I loved the ending but I've just gotta say:  a year of community service for robbing a bank?  Sounds like real life!  :)
Adorable movie! My kids loved it! I would love for there to be a sequel. Thanks for a great holiday movie! It sure got us in the Christmas mood!

Great!

My 2 year old son loves this.  We watch it every other day and it's one of those children's movies you won't find annoying to have on in the background.  The plot is complex and the story is long for a 2 year old, some might say, but it consistently keeps my son entertained while he is playing on the floor.  He asks for it whenever we go to browse things to watch together.  He loves the workshop scene, the penguin bank scene and the huge robot scene, and laughs and acts out those scenes.  Cute characters, beautiful and complex animation, rich story and plot - I am currently looking for more films like this on Amazon and hope the creators have similarly good content available to stream on Prime.
I asked my 5 year old daughter and my 8 year old son what they thought of it on a scale from 1 - 5 (5 being great and 1 meaning not good at all) and they both yelled GREAT!!

I thought this was a rather entertaining movie.  The penguin was funny and could leave younger viewers with a moral of never give up as he kept trying over and over to accomplish a certain action.  I did read about lack of morals and I semi agree with that at one point when they lied about a particular incident at first but then owned up and were honest about what happened.
Desperate for something to watch during a late bus time.  This held the attention of 4th graders...I was pleasantly surprised with this video!  Witty and well done.
